item.title: Ukraine’s New Strategy for Keeping the Lights On Through a Winter of War
item.description: Top-secret sites house rows of batteries designed to support the country’s power grid during bombardments.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Trump Praises Putin’s Offer to Extend Nuclear Treaty
item.description: An accord capping the number of long-range nuclear weapons was due to expire in February but would be extended by a year.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: How China Secretly Pays Iran for Oil and Avoids U.S. Sanctions
item.description: A hidden funding conduit has deepened economic ties between the two U.S. rivals in defiance of Washington’s efforts to isolate Tehran.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Gazans Have a Message for Hamas: End the War Now
item.description: Weary Palestinians say President Trump’s peace plan isn’t perfect, but a halt to the fighting is more important.
item.dc:creator: Abeer Ayyoub

item.title: What’s in Your Go-Bag? How Taiwan Packs for Disaster
item.description: Crisis prep has become personal on an island facing the threat of typhoons, earthquakes, tsunamis and military invasion.
item.dc:creator: An Rong Xu

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Are Set to Start in Egypt
item.description: The parties meeting in Cairo—including the U.S., Israel, Hamas and Middle Eastern countries—will try to come to agreements over the release of hostages.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Opinion | ‘All Hostages First’ Is the Key in Gaza
item.description: Trump tries to hold Hamas to the ‘yes’ in its ‘yes, but’ response.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Time for Milei to Stop Passing the Buck
item.description: A $20 billion swap line from the U.S. won’t cure what ails the Argentine peso.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: Opinion | EU Climate Rules Help China Hurt the Environment
item.description: Beijing pretends to comply, leaders in Brussels play along, and American companies bear the regulatory brunt.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Furchtgott

item.title: Opinion | The Next Prosecution of Donald Trump
item.description: Plans are under way to try him in the International Criminal Court. This time he can strike first.
item.dc:creator: Eugene Kontorovich

item.title: Japan’s Ruling Party, Following Global Trend, Veers Right
item.description: The election of Sanae Takaichi is a response to voter angst over immigration and other issues that is boosting conservatives and populists worldwide.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: The Women Who Helped Defeat ISIS Are Fighting for Their Place in the New Syria
item.description: Kurdish forces that have elevated women are wary of the Islamist values of Syria’s new governors.
item.dc:creator: Sudarsan Raghavan

item.title: How a Missile Strike Unlocked a Deal for Peace in Gaza
item.description: Talks between Israel and Hamas were deadlocked for months, until one incident pushed things to the brink.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Trump to Send Witkoff, Kushner to Middle East to Seal Hostage Release Deal
item.description: The high-profile delegation shows the president’s seriousness on securing a deal, despite significant concerns about the terms among all the parties involved.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Japan Set for First Female Prime Minister Amid U.S. Friction Over Trade, Security
item.description: Sanae Takaichi, elected leader of the ruling party, wants more spending and has floated reopening the trade agreement struck with Trump.
item.dc:creator: Junko Fukutome

item.title: Hamas Is Still at War With Itself Over Terms of Trump’s Peace Plan
item.description: Political leaders in Qatar are leaning toward accepting President Trump’s plan, but military commanders in Gaza are resisting surrendering arms and giving up hostages.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Hamas Agrees to Release Gaza Hostages, but Sets Conditions
item.description: President Trump said he believes the group is ready for a lasting peace and accepted that the talks could go on beyond his Sunday deadline.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Opinion | The Global Intifada Has Arrived in England
item.description: The country’s leaders created the environment in which a jihadist attacked a Manchester synagogue.
item.dc:creator: Dominic Green

item.title: Putin Warns West as Drones Appear in European Skies
item.description: The Russian leader says that Moscow is ready to respond to NATO efforts to boost support for Ukraine in the war.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Man Killed in U.K. Synagogue Attack Was Accidentally Shot by Police
item.description: One of those killed and one injured were hit by gunfire from officers who were trying to stop the attacker from entering the synagogue, police said.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: Who Is Sarah Mullally, the Anglican Church’s First Female Leader?
item.description: She has been named the first female Archbishop of Canterbury in the church’s nearly 500-year history. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Europe to Push Back as Illegal Drone Incursions Multiply
item.description: Germany pledged to tighten security laws to allow for faster detection and destruction of drones.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: Opinion | Europe’s New War on the Jews
item.description: Yom Kippur sees a terror attack in Britain, while Germany foils one.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: British Jews Say U.K. Terrorist Attack Was Just a Matter of Time
item.description: Since the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks by Hamas on Israel and the start of the war in Gaza, British Jews say they feel increasingly isolated and unsafe.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: Two Killed in Terrorist Attack at U.K. Synagogue
item.description: Several others were injured in the stabbing and ramming in Manchester on Yom Kippur, which prompted increased police security for Jewish congregations nationwide.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Mark Carney’s Shift From Climate-Change Warrior to Fossil-Fuel Cheerleader
item.description: Canada’s prime minister has scrapped green policies and pledged to transform the country ‘into an energy superpower.’
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: Trump’s Drone Deal With Ukraine to Give U.S. Access to Battlefield Tech
item.description: A team from Kyiv is in Washington this week to work out details of a landmark agreement that would involve sharing drone technology with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: Gaza-Bound Flotilla Activists Will Be Deported, Israel Says
item.description: Passengers on the roughly 40 vessels include Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, a grandson of Nelson Mandela and several European lawmakers.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Eurozone Joblessness Rises but Remains Close to Record Low
item.description: Unemployment rose to 6.3% in August, strengthening the possibility that the European Central Bank will lower interest rates next year after a period of pauses.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Hope Fades for Boys Trapped Under Collapsed Indonesian School
item.description: Officials said they could no longer detect signs of life from an Islamic boarding school that collapsed as teenage boys gathered to pray.
item.dc:creator: Ramadani Saputra

item.title: How Steve Schwarzman Landed in Hot Water With His British Neighbors
item.description: As trucks trundled through the English countryside to the Blackstone CEO’s manor estate, these locals wouldn’t settle until they’d solved the twin mysteries haunting villagers.
item.dc:creator: Joe Wallace

item.title: Rescuers Race to Free Boys Trapped in Collapsed Indonesian School
item.description: Dozens of students and staff remained under a multistory building that crumbled during an illegal expansion.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: France Detains Russian ‘Shadow Fleet’ Tanker Suspected in Drone Attack
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said authorities are investigating incursions into Danish airspace that rattled NATO allies.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Dalton

item.title: U.S. to Provide Ukraine With Intelligence for Missile Strikes Deep Inside Russia
item.description: The expanded intelligence-sharing with Kyiv is the latest sign that President Trump is deepening support for Ukraine as his efforts to advance peace talks have stalled.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Trump Signs Order That Could See U.S. Military Defend Qatar
item.description: The president’s executive order extends NATO-like security guarantees to the Middle East monarchy.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: German Firm’s African Green-Energy Project Runs Into Ghosts From Past
item.description: Namibia’s indigenous Nama population argues they have been sidelined in a $10 billion project being built on their ancestral lands.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: U.S. Pulls Plug on Haiti’s Last Big Industry
item.description: The end of a trade initiative imperils embattled clothing exporters that employ thousands who make garments for Hanes, Calvin Klein and Gap.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: Powerful Earthquake Kills at Least 69 People in Central Philippines
item.description: The Philippines sits in the so-called Ring of Fire, a seismic arc of volcanoes and fault lines around the Pacific basin.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: China’s Communist Party Replaces Senior Diplomat
item.description: Liu Jianchao is the latest to be caught up in Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s disciplinary purges.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Britain’s Leader Promised to Defeat Populism. So Far, He’s Losing.
item.description: Keir Starmer was billed as a European litmus test for pragmatism over populism. After a year in office, he trails in the polls.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Tourists Are Flocking to a Chinese Megacity That’s Straight Out of Sci-Fi
item.description: Dizzying architecture, bright lights and a cyberpunk vibe have made Chongqing a must-see destination for Chinese and international tourists alike.
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Russia’s Ambitious Plans in Africa Are Unraveling
item.description: Not long ago a rising military force in Africa, Russia is now struggling to maintain its footprint on the continent.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: The Slow Demise of Russian Oil
item.description: The toll of the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine and Western sanctions has hastened the decline in Russian oil production.
item.dc:creator: Ming Li

item.title: Xi Is Chasing Huge Concession From Trump: Opposing Taiwan Independence
item.description: The Chinese leader views President Trump’s eagerness for a trade deal as an opportunity to press for his top goal.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Rwanda’s President Turns to Sport to Give Tarnished Image a Makeover
item.description: Paul Kagame hopes to bring Formula One to a country accused of using rebels to take critical minerals from its neighbors.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Trump Is Reasserting U.S. Dominion Over Latin America
item.description: A region the administration sees as the “U.S.’s backyard” is crucial to the president’s goals of reining in migration and stemming drug flows.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: China’s Anti-Japan Dramas Get a Gen Z Makeover
item.description: China’s latest anti-Japanese cultural productions are tweaking the formula to grab the attention of a younger generation.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: China Industrial Profit Rose Sharply in August
item.description: China’s industrial profit rose significantly in August, suggesting Beijing’s recent ramped-up drive to curb excess capacity and rein in cutthroat business competition is starting to bear fruit.

item.title: China’s Premier Outlines Deeper Commitment to U.N.
item.description: The most senior-level Beijing official to address the General Assembly in a decade challenged tariffs and pledged a wider role.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: The Path to the American Dream Is Narrowing for Indian Tech Workers
item.description: About 70% of H-1B visas go to Indians. Looming changes to the program are upending plans, but may help India retain talent.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Canada Orders Revamp at Postal Service, Sparking Sudden Strike by Workers
item.description: Workers at Canada’s state-owned postal service went on strike on Thursday night.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Canada Watchdog Projects Wider Deficits in Near Term Amid Tariff-Fueled Struggles
item.description: Canada’s budget deficit is projected to widen and surpass 2% of the economy for the current and coming fiscal years due to weak growth and spending measures planned by Prime Minister Mark Carney to rewire the economy, according to the country’s fiscal watchdog.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Putin In No Mood to Negotiate, U.K. Spy Chief Says
item.description: In a veiled message to President Trump, the departing head of MI6 warned that the Russian president has no intention of stopping his war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump, Starmer Paper Over Cracks Amid Royal Pageantry
item.description: The two leaders projected unity despite differences over Palestinian statehood, immigration and energy policy.
item.dc:creator: Tarini Parti

item.title: Alexei Navalny’s Wife Says There Is Fresh Evidence He Was Poisoned
item.description: Yulia Navalnaya said tests in two separate laboratories prove the former presidential candidate and Russian President Vladimir Putin’s main opponent was killed.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Russia Hosts Surprise Guests at Its Wargames: U.S. Military Officers
item.description: The invitation came as President Trump is working to end the war in Ukraine and repair ties with Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Modi’s Strategy for Mending Ties With Trump: a Stiff Upper Lip
item.description: India’s prime minister has maintained a stoic silence in the face of sharp comments from Trump, while signaling he is eager to stay friends.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Kenya Uses U.S.-Funded Antiterrorism Courts for Political Crackdown
item.description: Young people who took to the streets to protest corruption and poor job prospects could face decades in maximum-security prison under a set of laws set up to combat al Qaeda.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: This Is the World’s Biggest Animal Migration—and Few Outsiders Have Seen It
item.description: Six million antelope storm through a pocket of Africa that’s nearly impossible to get to, but the Journal caught them on camera. “The entire planet should be amazed that this exists.”
item.dc:creator: Annie Ng

item.title: Putin Says Russia Will Strike Any Western Troops in Ukraine
item.description: The Russian leader’s comments came a day after European and U.S. officials met in Paris to discuss security guarantees for Kyiv.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: The Black Market for Oil Blunts Trump’s India Tariffs
item.description: The extra levy meant to punish New Delhi for buying cheap Russian crude isn’t going as expected.
item.dc:creator: Carol Ryan

item.title: U.S. Tariffs on India Skirt Its Biggest Buyer of Russian Oil
item.description: Reliance Industries accounts for about a third of the Russian oil India imports.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: India Braces for the Pain of Trump’s Stiff Tariffs
item.description: Duties that just took effect will hit billions of dollars of trade and hurt Indian sectors ranging from textiles to farming.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
